casebody.data:
STATE v. GEORGE DERRY. Court of Quarter Sessions. Kent. May 11, 1802. Rodney’s Notes. Vandyke [for State], Ridgély, Clayton [for defendant].

Sophia Darling sworn. Hannah Walmsley. Hannah Morris. Abner Douglas for prisoner. Charles Townsend, Corneille Battle.

Clayton for prisoner.

Cause rests upon the credit of Sophia Darling, a white woman, married to a black or yellow man.

E. Ridgély.

Shoes so much alike, difficult to identify, etc.

Attorney General in conclusion.

Verdict, guilty, and sentence thirteen lashes, etc.
